title: Do you have a right to cancel your contract?

steps.label: Fee Disclosed
steps.question: Was the fee disclosed to you in the initial disclosure statement before you signed the credit contract?

options.label: No
options.content: You probably have cause for complaint.

steps.label: Fee Clearly Described
steps.question: Was the fee clearly described? This means that your lender made it clear what the fee is for, the type of costs recovered, when your lender would charge the fee and why your lender would charge it.

options.label: No
options.content: You probably have cause for complaint

steps.label: Fee Type
steps.question: What type of fee has been charged

options.label: Other Fee
options.tooltip: Explanation of other types of fee

steps.label: Fee Reasonable
steps.question: Do you think that the fee only covers your lenderâ€™s reasonable costs in providing the relevant service? For example, an establishment fee must only cover administrative and set-up costs associated with your loan; a default fee must only cover costs associated with your default.

options.label: Yes
options.content: You do not have grounds for complaint

options.label: No
options.content: You may have grounds for complaint

options.label: Don't Know
options.content: You should ask your lender for further information
